definition: better to have nothing (than substandard choice) (idiom); would prefer to go without than accept shoddy option
abbr. for Ningxia Hui Autonomous Region 寧夏回族自治區|宁夏回族自治区[Ning2 xia4 Hui2 zu2 Zi4 zhi4 qu1]/abbr. for Nanjing 南京[Nan2 jing1]/surname Ning
peaceful/to pacify/to visit (one's parents etc)
would rather/to prefer/how (emphatic)/Taiwan pr. [ning2]
deficiency/lack/scarce/vacant post/to run short of
(literary) no/don't/to not have/nobody
surname Wu
overflowing/excessive/indiscriminate

sentences.english: I've been patient, believing the best is worth the wait.
sentences.chinese: 一直堅持寧缺毋濫，相信最好的值得耐心等待。

sentences.english: We has been patient, believing the best is worth the wait.
sentences.chinese: 我們一直堅持寧缺毋濫，相信最好的值得耐心等待。

sentences.english: When buying clothes, I go by the principle of quality over quantity.
sentences.chinese: 對於買衣服，我的原則是寧缺毋濫。

sentences.english: She has been patient, believing the best is worth the wait.
sentences.chinese: 她一直堅持寧缺毋濫，相信最好的值當耐心等候。

sentences.english: More and more people marry later nowadays. We should put quality before quantity.
sentences.chinese: 在現今人們結婚的年齡越來越晚，我們應該寧缺毋濫。

sentences.english: She has been patient, believing the good is worth the wait.
sentences.chinese: 她一直堅持寧缺毋濫，信任最好的值得耐心等待。

sentences.english: Tell the hiring manager what he wants to know and nothing more.
sentences.chinese: 告訴招聘經理他希望瞭解的，寧缺毋濫。

sentences.english: We must put quality before quantity; We should rather go without than have something shoddy.
sentences.chinese: 我們必須重視質量，寧缺毋濫。
請慎重選擇你的人際關係，寧缺毋濫。

definition: (of a couple) to be harmonious/to be each other's sunshine
to spend effort/to take trouble/May I trouble you to...? (as part of polite request)/Please would you mind...?
to obstinately persist in going about things the wrong way (idiom)
lit. to like the new, and hate the old (idiom); fig. enamored with new people (e.g. new girlfriend), bored with the old
lit. silly people get their panties in a bunch (idiom)/fig. to get upset over nothing/to make problems for oneself
to feel disheartened
unlucky
same as 寧缺毋濫|宁缺毋滥[ning4 que1 wu2 lan4]
man of Qǐ fears the sky falling (idiom); groundless fears
better to just get the pain over with, rather than prolong the agony
pinyin: chang2 tong4 bu4 ru2 duan3 tong4

definition: to admire talented people/to value talent
to resign oneself to adversity (idiom); to grin and bear it/to submit meekly to insults, maltreatment, humiliation etc
the moth flies into the flame/fatal attraction
clean-living and honest (idiom); to avoid immorality/to shun evil influence/to mind one's own business and keep out of trouble/to keep one's hands clean
to enjoy the present (idiom); to live happily with no thought for the future/make merry while you can/carpe diem
to be obsessive/to persist obstinately
to ask for trouble/to invite difficulties
